Microsoft Excel adds Copilot Al to help ...
theverge.com
The Verget-4.1-mini Al model | 5
successor to the LABS.GENERATIVEAI function Microsoft started experimenting
with in 2023.
Microsoft notes that you can combine its new Al function with other Excel functions, including IF, SWITCH, LAMBDA, or WRAPROWS. The company adds that information sent through Excel's COPILOT function is "never" used for AI training, as "the input remains confidential and is used solely to generate your requested output."
The COPILOT function comes with a couple of limitations, as it can't access information outside your spreadsheet, and you can only use it to calculate 100 functions every 10 minutes. Microsoft also warns against using the AI function for numerical calculations or in “high-stakes scenarios” with legal, regulatory, and compliance implications, as COPILOT "can
give incorrect responses."

record.text: Et accessoirement Qobuz est celui qui rémunère le mieux les artistes sans compter la HiRes, le magazine, l'abonnement famille moins cher... Bref au revoir Spotify et bon débarras !

J'ai pris un abonnement Qobuz et j'attends le renouvellement annuel Spotify famille pour le dégager. Ce que j'adore sur Qobuz c'est la mise en avant des choix de l'équipe et des nouvelles sorties. J'ai découvert tellement de nouveaux artistes et de genres. Sur Spotify c'était pas du tout le cas.
Ik heb er nu heel wat info in gegooid en hij heeft het zwaar. De copilot. Weet niet of mijn laptop stottert of de verbinding. Dus op kantoor even proberen verder mee te gaan. 😆
Vorige week was toilet op de intercity naar Groningen ook al defect (grote sticker erop). Nu weer. Ik vind dat eigenlijk echt niet kunnen op z'n lang traject. 🥹

Jawel maar alles wat we steeds krijgen (veel, want hype) is niet specifiek genoeg. Maar misschien moet ik het gewoon toch gaan doen, al die trainingen. Zodat ik het beste snap en zelf kan toepassen op wat ik nodig heb. Was nog druk met andere  cursus ook.

record.text: 情報の透明性に欠ける対応やCVE（共通脆弱性識別番号）の発行を拒否したことを批判しています。彼は、この沈黙がセキュリティや透明性を損なう危険性を孕んでおり、特に正確な監査証跡に依存する規制対象の組織にとっては重大な問題だと指摘しています。 (2/2)

💡 Summary: 

ザック・コーマンは、Microsoft 365 Copilotにセキュリティ上の欠陥があることを報告しました。この脆弱性により、活動記録を記録せずにファイルにアクセスできてしまい、セキュリティやコンプライアンスに重要な監査ログが危険にさらされる恐れがあります。コーマンが問題を指摘した後、Microsoftは修正を行いましたが、脆弱性の詳細を公開したり、影響を受ける顧客に通知したりしませんでした。そのため、多くの組織は自分たちのログに潜む潜在的な問題に気付かないままになっています。コーマンは、Microsoftの対応について、 (1/2)

コパイロットは監査ログを破壊したが、マイクロソフトは顧客に伝えない

external.description: Microsoft’un Redmond’daki merkez kampüsünde çalışanların gerçekleştirdiği protesto, gözleri bir kez daha yazılım devine çevirdi. Microsoft çalışanları, şirketin bulut hizmeti Azure’un İsrail ordusu tarafından Filistinlilerin gözetiminde kullanıldığı iddialarına dikkat çekti. Pankartlar ve sloganlarla süren eylem, şirketin sessizliğine karşı bir tepki niteliği taşıdı. Katılımcılar, alanı “Özgür Bölge” olarak adlandırarak sembolik bir mesaj vermeyi tercih etti. Protesto sırasında öne çıkan mesajlardan biri, işçilerin emeğinin soykırıma alet edilmemesi gerektiği yönündeydi.
external.title: Microsoft çalışanları şirketin İsrail ordusuyla bağlantısını genel merkezde protesto etti

Excel’de Copilot ile hücreleri doldurmak kolaylaşıyor

Microsoft Excel, uzun yıllardır iş dünyasında ve eğitimde en çok kullanılan yazılımlardan biri olmayı sürdürüyor. Şirket, bu kez kullanıcıların tablolar üzerinde daha hızlı işlem yapabilmesi için yapay zekâ destekli yeni bir araç üzerinde…

external.description: Microsoft Excel, uzun yıllardır iş dünyasında ve eğitimde en çok kullanılan yazılımlardan biri olmayı sürdürüyor. Şirket, bu kez kullanıcıların tablolar üzerinde daha hızlı işlem yapabilmesi için yapay zekâ destekli yeni bir araç üzerinde çalışıyor. Copilot adı verilen bu fonksiyon, kullanıcıların doğal dilde yazdığı komutları anlayarak hücreleri doldurabiliyor. Böylece geleneksel formüllerin karmaşıklığı olmadan işlemler daha kolay gerçekleşiyor. Yeni özellik, aslında Google Sheets’in Haziran ayında devreye aldığı yapay zekâ tabanlı fonksiyonlara benziyor.

external.description:
As streaming services continue to revolutionize the way we consume content, YouTube TV has emerged as a major player in the live television market. Offering a wide range of channels, cloud DVR functionality, and the ability to stream on multiple devices, it has attracted millions of subscribers. However, like any service, it has its strengths and weaknesses. Whether you’re considering making the switch to YouTube TV or curious about its offerings, this article explores the **pros and cons of YouTube TV** in detail.

Table of Contents

Toggle

  * What is YouTube TV?
  * Pros of YouTube TV
    * 1. Extensive Channel Selection
    * 2. Cloud DVR with Unlimited Storage
    * 3. User-Friendly Interface
    * 4. Multi-Device Support
    * 5. No Cable Box Required
    * 6. Live Streaming and Sports Coverage
    * 7. Easy Cancellation
  * Cons of YouTube TV
    * 1. Price Point
    * 2. Regional Restrictions
    * 3. Limited Simultaneous Streams
    * 4. Lack of Certain Channels
    * 5. Internet Dependency
    * 6. Ads during Live TV
  * Comparing YouTube TV with Traditional Cable Services
  * Is YouTube TV Right for You?
    * 1. What are your viewing preferences?
    * 2. Are you budget-conscious?
    * 3. Are you tech-savvy?
    * 4. Do you have sufficient internet connectivity?
  * Final Thoughts
  * What are the main advantages of YouTube TV?
  * What are the downsides of YouTube TV?
  * How does YouTube TV compare to traditional cable?
  * Is YouTube TV suitable for families?
  * Can I watch YouTube TV without an internet connection?
  * What devices are compatible with YouTube TV?
  * Does YouTube TV offer any features for sports fans?



## What is YouTube TV?

YouTube TV is an online streaming television service developed by YouTube, a subsidiary of Google. Launched in 2017, it allows users to access live television programming from major networks, along with a variety of cable channels. With its focus on accessibility and convenience, YouTube TV allows customers to watch their favorite shows and sports from virtually anywhere with an internet connection.

## Pros of YouTube TV

YouTube TV offers numerous advantages that have contributed to its growing popularity. Here are some of the standout features:

### 1. Extensive Channel Selection

YouTube TV provides access to over **85 channels** , which include local broadcast networks, popular cable channels, and even some premium options. This extensive channel lineup covers a wide range of categories including sports, news, entertainment, and lifestyle, appealing to diverse viewing preferences.

### 2. Cloud DVR with Unlimited Storage

One of YouTube TV’s most appealing features is its **cloud DVR service**. Users receive unlimited storage space to record live TV, allowing them to save their favorite shows and movies for later viewing. Additionally, saved programming does not expire, giving viewers the freedom to watch at their convenience.

### 3. User-Friendly Interface

Navigating through YouTube TV is a seamless experience thanks to its **intuitive interface**. Users can easily find and manage their channels, recorded content, and suggested shows, making it simple for anyone, even those who may not be tech-savvy, to enjoy the service.

### 4. Multi-Device Support

YouTube TV allows streaming on various devices, including smartphones, tablets, smart TVs, and desktop computers. Its compatibility with platforms such as Chromecast, Roku, and Apple TV enhances its accessibility, granting users flexibility in how and where they watch their programming.

### 5. No Cable Box Required

For those fed up with traditional cable subscriptions, YouTube TV presents a favorable alternative. There is **no need for a cable box** , and installation is straightforward, requiring nothing more than a reliable internet connection.

### 6. Live Streaming and Sports Coverage

With YouTube TV, users can enjoy live sports from major leagues such as the NFL, NBA, MLB, and NHL. Subscribers can also access regional sports networks, making it a great option for the avid sports fan.

### 7. Easy Cancellation

Unlike traditional cable companies, YouTube TV offers a **flexible subscription model**. Users can cancel their subscription with little hassle, without the fear of long-term contracts or hidden fees.

## Cons of YouTube TV

Despite its impressive features, YouTube TV is not without its drawbacks. Here are some potential downsides to consider:

### 1. Price Point

As of 2023, YouTube TV’s subscription price hovers around **$64.99 per month,** which can be steep compared to other streaming services. While the extensive channel offerings and features may justify the cost for some, others might find it difficult to budget for such an expense.

### 2. Regional Restrictions

YouTube TV’s **channel availability can vary by location** , which means certain users may not have access to all desired channels. This limitation may lead to frustrations for viewers in areas where specific content is unavailable.

### 3. Limited Simultaneous Streams

With YouTube TV, users are permitted to stream on up to **three devices** simultaneously. While this is adequate for most households, larger families or shared living situations may encounter challenges when trying to watch different programs at the same time.

### 4. Lack of Certain Channels

While YouTube TV includes many popular channels, it may lack some niche offerings that can be found on other platforms. For instance, certain premium channels like HBO, which require additional subscriptions, may not appeal to viewers seeking comprehensive options.

### 5. Internet Dependency

As a streaming service, YouTube TV requires a **stable and fast internet connection.** Users in areas with slow or unreliable internet may experience buffering, streaming failures, or degraded video quality, detracting from the viewing experience.

### 6. Ads during Live TV

Unlike some on-demand services, YouTube TV features **advertisements** during live broadcasts. Viewers accustomed to ad-free experiences may find this frustrating, especially during critical moments of their favorite shows or sporting events.

## Comparing YouTube TV with Traditional Cable Services

When weighing the benefits of YouTube TV, it’s helpful to compare it to traditional cable services.

Feature | YouTube TV | Traditional Cable
---|---|---
Monthly Cost | Starts at $64.99 | Varies (Often higher)
Contract | No long-term contracts | Usually requires a contract
Channel Selection | 85+ channels | Varies widely
Cloud DVR | Unlimited storage | Varies (often limited)
Installation | No installation required | Installation often necessary

In essence, YouTube TV provides a flexible, user-centric alternative, while traditional cable services can often feel cumbersome due to contracts and installation requirements.

## Is YouTube TV Right for You?

Deciding whether to go with YouTube TV or another service ultimately boils down to personal needs and viewing habits. To help you make an informed decision, consider the following questions:

### 1. What are your viewing preferences?

If you primarily watch live television, sports, or specific show genres found on YouTube TV, the service may align well with your interests.

### 2. Are you budget-conscious?

Evaluate your budget to determine if YouTube TV’s monthly subscription fits within your financial plans. If the price is high for your preferences, exploring lower-cost alternatives may be worthwhile.

### 3. Are you tech-savvy?

If you enjoy utilizing technology and appreciate a user-friendly streaming platform, YouTube TV’s interface may enhance your viewing experience.

### 4. Do you have sufficient internet connectivity?

Fast and reliable internet is crucial for uninterrupted streaming. Ensure your internet plan meets the necessary requirements outlined by YouTube TV.

## Final Thoughts

YouTube TV offers a compelling streaming option for those seeking an alternative to traditional cable. With its **user-friendly features** , a broad range of channels, and the flexibility of a cloud DVR, it has established itself as a competitive choice in the streaming market. However, its price point and some limitations may not appeal to every viewer.

Ultimately, while YouTube TV has numerous pros, it is essential to weigh these against its cons to determine if it meets your specific viewing preferences and budget. As streaming continues to grow, services like YouTube TV will likely evolve, making it essential to stay updated on new developments and offerings.

## What are the main advantages of YouTube TV?

YouTube TV offers an extensive channel lineup that includes major networks like ABC, CBS, NBC, and more, making it a great choice for viewers who want access to live TV. The service is also known for its user-friendly interface, allowing easy navigation and discovery of content. With unlimited DVR storage, users can record shows and watch them later, ensuring they never miss their favorite programs.

Additionally, YouTube TV is accessible on a variety of devices, including smartphones, tablets, smart TVs, and streaming devices. This versatility makes it easy to watch content anytime, anywhere. The service supports multiple user accounts, allowing family members to have personalized viewing experiences while maintaining their own DVR library.

## What are the downsides of YouTube TV?

One of the major downsides of YouTube TV is its cost, which can be significantly higher than other streaming services. While it provides a lot of channels and features, some viewers may find the monthly subscription fee less appealing, especially if they’re primarily interested in basic content. Additionally, features like regional sports networks may not be available in all areas, limiting access to certain live events for some subscribers.

Another downside is that YouTube TV often lacks some channels that viewers might expect to find on traditional cable services, such as some premium channels and localized options. Furthermore, some users have reported occasional streaming issues, like buffering or picture quality problems, especially during peak viewing times. This can detract from the overall viewing experience.

## How does YouTube TV compare to traditional cable?

YouTube TV provides several benefits over traditional cable, including flexibility and ease of use. With no long-term contracts, users can subscribe or cancel their service at any time, making it a more adaptable option for those with changing viewing needs. The unlimited DVR feature also sets it apart, allowing for the recording and storage of countless shows and movies without the constraints typically associated with cable box storage.

On the flip side, traditional cable services may offer more extensive channel packages, including niche networks that might be missing from YouTube TV. Many users also appreciate the reliability of cable, as there are fewer streaming issues as compared to internet-based services. Costs can vary dramatically based on packages, regional availability, and additional service fees, making it essential for viewers to weigh their options carefully.

## Is YouTube TV suitable for families?

Yes, YouTube TV is well-suited for families with its capability to support multiple accounts under a single subscription. This feature allows family members to maintain separate watch histories and personalized recommendations, catering to the diverse preferences of each viewer. Additionally, the unlimited DVR capacity means that different shows and movies can be recorded for individual viewing without sacrificing storage space.

The platform also includes a variety of channels and content types, ranging from news and sports to family-friendly programming and popular movies. This wide selection makes it easy for family members of all ages to find something appealing. The parental controls provided by YouTube TV allow parents to manage content access, ensuring a safer viewing atmosphere for children.

## Can I watch YouTube TV without an internet connection?

No, YouTube TV cannot be accessed without an internet connection. As a streaming service, it requires a stable internet connection to view live broadcasts, recorded shows, and on-demand content. This reliance on the internet is important to consider, especially for users in areas with unreliable or slow connections, as it may hinder the overall viewing experience.

However, users can download certain content to compatible devices for offline viewing. This feature provides some flexibility for those on the go or without consistent internet access at all times. Still, it’s essential to keep in mind that live broadcasts will still necessitate a connection when the content is being aired.

## What devices are compatible with YouTube TV?

YouTube TV is compatible with a variety of devices, providing users with flexibility in how they access content. You can stream YouTube TV on smartphones and tablets using the YouTube app, smart TVs from brands like Samsung, LG, and Vizio, and various streaming devices such as Roku, Amazon Fire TV, and Apple TV. This broad compatibility ensures that most users can find a way to watch their favorite channels.

Additionally, YouTube TV is available for web browsers, allowing users to stream content on desktops or laptops. However, it’s essential to ensure that your device meets the necessary requirements for optimal performance, including a strong internet connection. The wide range of devices helps users enjoy content across different settings and preferences.

## Does YouTube TV offer any features for sports fans?

Yes, YouTube TV includes many features that cater specifically to sports fans. The service offers a wide array of sports channels, including ESPN, NBC Sports, and regional sports networks, allowing viewers to catch live games across various sports. This extensive coverage makes it easier for fans to follow their favorite teams, whether it be football, basketball, or baseball.

Moreover, YouTube TV’s unlimited DVR feature is particularly beneficial for sports fans who want to record games they can’t watch live. This allows them the freedom to enjoy the action at their convenience without worrying about missing critical moments. Additionally, the platform often includes features like live stats and interactive content related to ongoing games, enhancing the overall viewing experience for sports enthusiasts.
external.title: The Pros and Cons of YouTube TV: A Comprehensive Guide

Another downside is that YouTube TV often lacks some channels that viewers might expect to find on traditional cable services, such as some premium channels and localized options. Furthermore, some users have reported occasional streaming issues, like buffering or picture quality problems, especially during peak viewing times. This can detract from the overall viewing experience.

## How does YouTube TV compare to traditional cable?

YouTube TV provides several benefits over traditional cable, including flexibility and ease of use. With no long-term contracts, users can subscribe or cancel their service at any time, making it a more adaptable option for those with changing viewing needs. The unlimited DVR feature also sets it apart, allowing for the recording and storage of countless shows and movies without the constraints typically associated with cable box storage.

On the flip side, traditional cable services may offer more extensive channel packages, including niche networks that might be missing from YouTube TV. Many users also appreciate the reliability of cable, as there are fewer streaming issues as compared to internet-based services. Costs can vary dramatically based on packages, regional availability, and additional service fees, making it essential for viewers to weigh their options carefully.

## Is YouTube TV suitable for families?

Yes, YouTube TV is well-suited for families with its capability to support multiple accounts under a single subscription. This feature allows family members to maintain separate watch histories and personalized recommendations, catering to the diverse preferences of each viewer. Additionally, the unlimited DVR capacity means that different shows and movies can be recorded for individual viewing without sacrificing storage space.

The platform also includes a variety of channels and content types, ranging from news and sports to family-friendly programming and popular movies. This wide selection makes it easy for family members of all ages to find something appealing. The parental controls provided by YouTube TV allow parents to manage content access, ensuring a safer viewing atmosphere for children.

## Can I watch YouTube TV without an internet connection?

No, YouTube TV cannot be accessed without an internet connection. As a streaming service, it requires a stable internet connection to view live broadcasts, recorded shows, and on-demand content. This reliance on the internet is important to consider, especially for users in areas with unreliable or slow connections, as it may hinder the overall viewing experience.

However, users can download certain content to compatible devices for offline viewing. This feature provides some flexibility for those on the go or without consistent internet access at all times. Still, it’s essential to keep in mind that live broadcasts will still necessitate a connection when the content is being aired.

## What devices are compatible with YouTube TV?

YouTube TV is compatible with a variety of devices, providing users with flexibility in how they access content. You can stream YouTube TV on smartphones and tablets using the YouTube app, smart TVs from brands like Samsung, LG, and Vizio, and various streaming devices such as Roku, Amazon Fire TV, and Apple TV. This broad compatibility ensures that most users can find a way to watch their favorite channels.

Additionally, YouTube TV is available for web browsers, allowing users to stream content on desktops or laptops. However, it’s essential to ensure that your device meets the necessary requirements for optimal performance, including a strong internet connection. The wide range of devices helps users enjoy content across different settings and preferences.

## Does YouTube TV offer any features for sports fans?

Yes, YouTube TV includes many features that cater specifically to sports fans. The service offers a wide array of sports channels, including ESPN, NBC Sports, and regional sports networks, allowing viewers to catch live games across various sports. This extensive coverage makes it easier for fans to follow their favorite teams, whether it be football, basketball, or baseball.

Moreover, YouTube TV’s unlimited DVR feature is particularly beneficial for sports fans who want to record games they can’t watch live. This allows them the freedom to enjoy the action at their convenience without worrying about missing critical moments. Additionally, the platform often includes features like live stats and interactive content related to ongoing games, enhancing the overall viewing experience for sports enthusiasts.

Phison SSD 在 Windows 11 更新後出現故障
https://wccftech.com/phison-acknowledges-ssd-failures-on-windows-11-due-to-kb5063878-kb5062660-updates-starts-investigations-on-its-controllers-to-resolve-the-issue/

近期 Windows 11 的累積更新 KB5063878 與 KB5062660，被發現會導致部分 SSD 在執行大量寫入作業時出現故障。受影響的產品主要來自使用 Phison 控制器的 SSD，尤其是搭載 PS5012-E12 的型號，包括 Corsair Force MP600、SanDisk Extreme Pro、Maxio SSD 等，且大部分案例由日本用戶回報。Phison 已正式承認問題存在，並表示正與合作夥伴合作，蒐集故障回報並測試受影響的控制器，目前將專注於透過廠商提供韌體更新與建議，而非直接對終端用戶支援。在問題解決前，建議使用者避免在受影響的 SSD 上進行大量資料寫入，以降低風險。

record.text: So, what is the ethical position here?

If you let algorithms decide to flag chats with some "psychological alert" and then you get a call from some social services or whatever, that's a major breach of privacy.

If you don't install such measures, you're exposing a big chunk of the population to harmful psychoactive technology.

What is the ethical position on that, dear net activists?

Therapy bots will stay with us as long as there are language simulators, because we will always use them not just for work or play, but also consult them with private issues of all kind, including psychological issues big and small.

MIT’s NANDA initiative found that 95% of generative AI deployments fail after interviewing 150 execs, surveying 350 workers, and analyzing 300 projects. The real “productivity gains” seem to come from layoffs and squeezing more work from fewer people not AI.

external.description: There’s a stark difference in success rates between companies that purchase AI tools from vendors and those that build them internally.
external.title: MIT report: 95% of generative AI pilots at companies are failing

record.text: Finding it hard to concentrate? Are you glued to social media for longer than you’d like? Well, maybe it’s not you… maybe it’s the phones.

external.description:
Finding it hard to concentrate? Are you glued to social media for longer than you’d like? Well, maybe it’s not you… maybe it’s the phones.

Brittany is joined by Magdalene Taylor, writer, cultural critic and senior editor at Playboy, and Fio Geiran, producer at TED Radio Hour and a writer of their Body Electric newsletter, to discuss this phrase: “it’s the phones.” They get into the effects that smartphones have on our brains and our culture, why some people are returning to “dumbphones,” and why it might take more than willpower to manage our relationships with our phones.
external.title: How to get out of a love-hate relationship with your phone : It's Been a Minute

MaRo is getting dragged for saying this but he's completely correct. I am less overwhelmed by Magic than ever because I know I can skip any set that doesnt make me clap like a seal and I am having more fun playing Magic discovering new cards every game.

images.alt:
A Mark Rosewater Tumblr post from https://www.tumblr.com/markrosewater/791980596663599104/mark-i-would-like-to-voice-a-grievance-i-and


"You're right. Pointing out that we've gone down in sets is missing the larger issue, so let me dive into that. I think R&D, over the last decade, has significantly shifted in how it thinks about the players' interaction with the game. Magic, by its very definition, is a game "bigger than the box". The game has over 30,000+ cards. No one person can possibly absorb it all.
For many years, our solution was to carve out a lot of sub-groupings. Here's a way to play Magic with a much smaller card pool. This way you can just focus on those cards, and that will be something you can wrap your mind around.

Then came Commander, which seemed to completely fly in the face of this whole philosophy.
The format basically gives the players access to every card (okay, almost). This means you are exposed to all the cards, all the mechanics, all the sets, all the things we've done over the years. It's the exact opposite of limiting access.
And Commander took on a level of popularity we'd never seen before. What if the correct way to handle the immensity of the information wasn't to chop it down to bite-size? What if we just embraced the complexity? Let the players have access to it all (or at least, a lot of it) and let them sort through it in whatever way works best for them.

In other words, we stopped prioritizing the mind set of players being able to absorb it all.
Interestingly, it kind of ties into Richard Garfield's original vision of Magic. He purposefully didn't want players to know everything. In the early days, Wizards didn't provide a list of the cards. The idea was you would learn about them as you played.
The Internet then came along and made it impossible to hide information. But now, thirty plus years in, the sheer scope of the information has actually allowed us to do the thing that Richard originally wanted. You can't learn it all.

Embracing this philosophy has affected many things. It changed how we built Commander decks.
It allowed us to raise the complexity level of sets (although we still have limits). It let us make cameo cards, to bring back popular old mechanics in smaller doses. It let us increase the size of Standard both in time and number of sets.
The challenge is there are players who are accustomed to the old ways, who are used to being able to grok everything at once, and this new system does not make that easy. In fact, it's near impossible. I get that this change over is a bit disorienting, but we believe once people get used to the new status quo, to the idea that no one person is supposed to absorb everything, that it will lead to a richer, more enjoyable means of interacting with the game."

record.text: kitchenware with extra-sensory powers?

実際「中高年男性が駅や電車内で性加害している生成画像」をご自身の主義主張のために捏造していたXアカウントあったけど、あれだって生成された画像の人物が偶然自分に似てたらめちゃくちゃ怖いなと思ったし、話題にもなった卒アルの写真から猥褻画像が生成される事例も含めて、いつ自分自身が被害者になるかわからない訳で、それが簡単に出来るツールの存在と、それを実現させる大量の元データの存在を考えたら気軽に使えるものでは無いよなぁと考えてしまう。

Xでバズってた「生成AIの被害の深刻さは著作権問題よりも架空のネイチャーフォトによる情報汚染」の話、「著作権問題よりも」の文言に引っかかってしまいがちだけど、非クリエイターつまりChat-GPTとかGrokをカジュアルに使う一般層には著作権が云々って言ってもあまり伝わらなくて、身近で困りそうな問題であるディープフェイクを含む偽情報の話をした方がわかりやすいとこあるのかなと思う。

検索して出てきた結果が「これまで以上に」真偽不明であること、架空の被害捏造に使われた画像の人物が偶然自分に似てしまう可能性があること、みたいな自分自身が不利益を被る事例で訴えかける方が刺さる気がする。

自分の居るジャンルは表現云々の前に工作であり技術が大事だから、レジンや筋彫りを頑張る前に基礎技術をしっかり習得しないと作品のクオリティは上がっていかないんですよね。

なので口うるさくまずは縁処理！断面処理！丁寧に切る！って言ってる。

基本である1、2、3をきちんと練習しないで、いきなり4とか5をやるな、と亡くなったジャイアント馬場選手も言ってましたが、ほんとこれだと思います。
